title: Celebrating 20 Years: Night Sky Network
summary: by Vivan White & Kat Troche of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific NASA’s Night Sky Network is one of the most successful and longstanding grassroots initiatives for public engagement in astronomy education. title: Sols 4393-4395: Weekend Work at the Base of Texoli Butte
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, Dec. 13, 2024 Curiosity continues to make great progress over the Mount Sharp bedrock and will spend the weekend investigating the northern base of the “Texoli” butte. The science team back on Earth enjoyed taking in the beautiful views of nearby “Wilkerson” butte and “Gould Mesa” while digging into the workspace […]

title: NASA Welcomes Thailand as Newest Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: Following a signing ceremony Monday in Thailand’s capital city, Bangkok, NASA congratulates Thailand as the 51st nation to commit to the safe and responsible exploration of space that benefits humanity. “Thailand’s commitment to the Artemis Accords will enhance the country’s engagement with NASA and the international community,” said NASA Administrator Bill Nelson. “By signing the accords, Thailand builds upon […]

title: NASA Names New Leader of STEM Engagement
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson announced Monday Elaine P. Ho will serve as the next associate administrator of NASA’s Office of STEM Engagement (OSTEM), where she will lead the agency’s efforts to inspire Artemis Generation students and educators in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM). The role, based out of the agency’s headquarters in Washington, is […]

title: NASA Mars Orbiter Spots Retired InSight Lander to Study Dust Movement
summary: New images taken from space show how dust on and around InSight is changing over time — information that can help scientists learn more about the Red Planet.

title: NASA Mars Orbiter Spots Retired InSight Lander to Study Dust Movement
summary: New images taken from space show how dust on and around InSight is changing over time — information that can help scientists learn more about the Red Planet. title: NASA’s Webb Finds Planet-Forming Disks Lived Longer in Early Universe
summary: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope just solved a conundrum by proving a controversial finding made with the agency’s Hubble Space Telescope more than 20 years ago. In 2003, Hubble provided evidence of a massive planet around a very old star, almost as old as the universe. Such stars possess only small amounts of heavier elements […]

title: Planet-forming discs lived longer in early Universe
summary: Our understanding of planet formation in the Universe’s early days is challenged by new data from the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope. Webb solved a puzzle by proving a controversial finding made with the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope more than 20 years ago.

title: NASA DAVINCI Mission’s Many ‘Firsts’ to Unlock Venus’ Hidden Secrets
summary: NASA’s DAVINCI probe will be first in 21st century to brave Venus’ atmosphere as it descends from above the planet down to its surface.
